title: Cramped Living Room? These Are the 14 Best Couches for Small Spaces
description: We New York-based editors know the struggle all too well...
excerpt: The best couches for small spaces include multifunctional sofas and cozy loveseats. Here, shop 14 great options ideal for tight spaces and apartments.

Best Overall Couch for Small Spaces

Joss & Main Lucia Slipcovered Sofa

Pros

  • Lots of color options
  • Throw pillows included
  • Washable slipcovers

Cons

  • Some reviewers note slipcovers shrink in wash

Backed by over 1,200 reviews and an average 4.7-star rating, Joss & Main’s Lucia couch is our top pick for any small space. This countryside style will easily match a rustic theme, but it’s versatile enough to work with a variety of aesthetics. It’s made to order, so it requires zero assembly, plus it has a cushy slip-covered design and down-fill pillows that offer just the right amount of sinkage.

Dimensions: Width: 82.5 inches; depth: 40 inches

Colors: 87 options

Customer review: “Excellent quality, exactly what I had been searching for. I was concerned it would take over the room; instead, it makes the room seem larger.”

Best Budget Couch for Small Spaces

Novogratz Brittany Sofa

Pros

  • Multifunctional design
  • Good value

Cons

  • Some reviewers think it’s too firm

If you’re seeking an affordable couch for your first place, we recommend this option. The tufted design costs under $350, and it also doubles as a futon for houseguests to sleep on.

Dimensions: Width: 81.5 inches; depth: 34.5 inches

Colors: 23 options

Customer review: “For such a cheap price, I wasn’t expecting a lot, but I’m impressed. This sits in my home office and is just comfortable enough to use for seating there; not too plush, but not like a rock, either. I’ll plan on adding a foam mattress pad when guests use it.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Sectional for Small Spaces

Sundays Movie Night Modular Sectional

Pros

  • Cloud-like comfort
  • Removable covers for easy cleaning
  • Modular

Cons

  • Some reviewers note it’s not liquid-resistant

Still set on owning a sectional? You can make some styles work for small spaces by getting creative with the layout. For instance, try Sundays’ cloud-like version to divvy up the bedroom and living area in a studio apartment. The three-piece design is outfitted in performance-grade fabric to handle wear and tear, too.

Dimensions: Width: 76 inches; depth: 76 inches

Colors: 6 options

Customer review: “The most comfortable and beautiful couch I’ve ever owned! Movie nights have never felt better. The couch is beyond cozy, stunning, and easy to clean.”

Best Sleeper Couch for Small Spaces

Interior Define Ella Sleeper Sofa

Pros

  • Lots of options for customization
  • Multifunctional

If space is tight, there’s a good chance you don’t have a spare bedroom for guests. Interior Define’s sleeper is the next best thing. It folds out into a twin-sized bed and is completely customizable, with options to choose everything from the fabric to the cushion fill and even the type of mattress.

Dimensions: Width: 64 inches; depth: 43 inches

Colors: 130 options

Customer review: “We’ve had our Ella sofa for about four months and I have been very pleased! It’s comfortable, sturdy, and easy to vacuum up hair from my cats.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Velvet Couch for Small Spaces

Allmodern Kearney Upholstered Loveseat

Pros

  • Spill-resistant fabric
  • Quick to ship

Cons

  • Sits low to the ground

Webster loves a curved couch, noting that the shape can make even the smallest design feel like a stylistic choice. This top-rated version is even more luxurious in a few rich velvet finishes.

Dimensions: 60.62 inches; depth: 30.7 inches

Colors: 7 options

Customer review: “Absolutely love almost everything about this sofa! Just the right color, soft fabric, and fits my space well.”

Best Leather Couch for Small Spaces

Article Sven Charme Sofa

Pros

  • Comes with bolster cushions
  • Quick to ship

Cons

  • Cushions require regular fluffing to retain shape

Between its warm caramel color and untreated leather finish, this Article option will only look softer, cozier, and more vintage-y over time.

Dimensions: Width: 72 inches; depth: 38 inches

Colors: Charme Tan, Charme Charcoal, Oxford Black, Oxford Blue

Customer review: “I don’t even know where to start to articulate how much we love this sofa. It’s perfect. Texture, feel, quality, design, comfort. Everything is five out of five.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Tufted Couch for Small Spaces

West Elm Avalon Channeled Sofa

Pros

  • Lots of color and fabric options
  • Hand-upholstered and assembled

Cons

  • Cushions might be too firm for some preferences

“I love styles with a channel tuft upholstered in a bold color,” says Webster. “Although they’re small, they hold a lot of visual weight.” Not only does this retro-leaning West Elm style come in over 100 colors, but it also has a kiln-dried wood frame that’s made to last.

Dimensions: Width: 68.5 inches; depth: 40.25 inches

Colors: 100 options

Best Mid-Century Couch for Small Spaces

Article Burrard Seasalt Loveseat

We usually don’t offer more than one recommendation from a brand per story, but Article’s options are too good to ignore. This loveseat has an angular profile that won’t make your space look cluttered. Meanwhile, the deep cushions are filled with a high-resiliency foam for support.

Dimensions: 67 inches; depth: 35 inches

Colors: Seasalt Ivory, Forest Green, Seasalt Gray

Customer review: “The Burrard loveseat was a perfect match for my tight space. It is very comfortable and looks great!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Antique-Style Couch for Small Spaces

Birch Lane Cecelia Loveseat

Pros

  • Reviewers say it’s easy to assemble
  • Fast shipping for a made-to-order piece

Cons

  • Cushion covers aren’t removable

Offering all the charm of a rare vintage gem without the high price, this compact couch packs a punch. It comes in nine striking patterns and has detailed legs made of solid pine for extra character.

Dimensions: Width: 47 inches; depth: 34 inches

Colors: 9 options

Customer review: “Without arms, it feels airy and adaptable, but it’s very substantial and comfortable, easily accommodating two adults and a small child or two.”

Best Deep Couch for Small Spaces

Castlery Mori Armless Sofa

Pros

  • Comes in multiple configurations

Cons

  • Only one color option
  • Reviewers note it’s easy to clean

If your idea of the perfect sofa involves deep, plush cushions, Castlery’s armless loveseat is the way to go. The feather-filled seats are almost 50 inches deep, with a sleek Japandi look that’ll fit in seamlessly with a minimalist space.

Dimensions: Width: 66.9 inches; depth: 45.7 inches

Colors: Performance Alpine

Customer review: “I can’t tell you enough just how much I love this couch. It’s even more comfortable and spacious than I envisioned, with cloud-like but supportive cushions that will make your cat nap turn into an all-day affair.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Sustainable Couch for Small Spaces

Sabai The Evergreen Loveseat

Pros

  • Good color options
  • Individual pieces can be replaced directly through Sabai to prolong the couch’s lifespan

Cons

  • Made-to-order shipping
  • No back pillows

Yes, this sloped sofa is stunning, but perhaps the best part about it is that it’s entirely eco-friendly. From recycled upholstery to certified high-resiliency foam and non-toxic materials, every part of this piece was designed with sustainability in mind.

Dimensions: 64 inches; depth: 36.25 inches

Colors: 13 options

Customer review: “Not only does it elevate our space with its timeless beauty and plush comfort, but it also echoes our commitment to a greener world.”

Best Performance Couch for Small Spaces

Albany Park Kova Sofa

Pros

  • Removable cushions with hypoallergenic fill
  • Quick to ship

Cons

  • Reviewers note the cushions tend to slide around

If you love to host or are simply prone to spilling, you’ll want a sofa that’s up to the task. This compact option comes in a range of performance materials—including basketweave and bouclé styles—that are designed to be stain-proof and hypoallergenic.

Dimensions: 85.5 inches; depth: 39 inches

Colors: 13 options

Customer review: “This sofa is perfection. I could easily sleep here all night. The frame is sturdy and feels high quality. The seats are so nice and wide, and the back and arms have this nice wide armrest area that's almost like a little shelf for your book or phone if you don't have a table nearby.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best 2-in-1 Couch for Small Spaces

Burrow Range 2-Piece Sofa

Pros

  • Customizable
  • Easy to assemble
  • Quick to ship

Cons

  • Cushions are on the firm side

While we love that this pick is customizable (you can choose the seat color, leg finish, and even tack on a matching ottoman), its real draw is its built-in side table. The wooden surface is sturdy and has enough room to hold a stack of books or few glasses of wine.

Dimensions: 74.5 inches; height: 28 inches; depth: 31 inches

Colors: 6 options

Customer review: “This side table is a fantastic addition to my living space! It attaches securely to the couch, making it super convenient for holding drinks, remotes, or a laptop. The design is sleek and modern, and the quality feels sturdy and well-made. Assembly was easy, and it fits perfectly without taking up too much space.”

Best Chair and a Half for Small Spaces

Floyd Home Sink Down Lounge Chair

Pros

  • Ultimate space-saving option
  • Eco-conscious upholstery options available

Cons

  • Might not fit multiple people

If you really don’t have the room for a couch, consider a chair and a half—a unique seating option that’s basically a hybrid between an accent chair and a loveseat. This version is extra deep and has memory foam pillows, so you can still get comfortable.

Dimensions: Width: 51 inches; depth: 45 inches

Colors: 14 options

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

What to consider when shopping for a small space-friendly couch

Size. Choosing the right size couch depends on the actual dimensions of your space, but in general, we recommend selecting options no more than 90 inches wide to prevent them from looking bulky. Most of the options on our list are in the 60-inch range.

Room layout and scale. “It’s all about having the right size in a smaller room,” explains Webster. “People tend to think furniture needs to be up against a wall, but in a smaller space, it’s nice to float a sofa in the room and have an interesting table or cabinet behind it. It almost creates two rooms each with an intentional purpose.”

To that end, be sure to examine the back of the sofa for interesting curves or features (like a woven backing or wooden slats) that allow it to stand alone. Additionally, consider the height of the sofa to ensure something like a console table would fit behind it.

Price. Since a sofa will be one of the more visible furniture items in a studio or multipurpose living area, Webster recommends making it your investment piece, if you can swing it. “For smaller spaces, it’s sometimes worth the splurge to go custom and get one that will make the space functional,” she says. Or, try your luck at an estate sale—Webster says you can always get a cheaper piece reupholstered to make it look more expensive.

Meet the Expert

  • Deidre Webster is the principal and lead interior designer of Minneapolis-based firm Studio Day.
